The Shaikh agrees that sole discretion as to the appointment of agents (a) to manage and (b) to maintain the aerodrome or aerodromes on their behalf shall be vested in His Majesty's Government during the period ofihis Agreement. Such a 6 ents sna^x exercise suporvisioni in respect of such aerodrome or aerodromes, necessary for the carrying out of the Air Navigation Regulations, vrith the exception of Air Sanitary formalities which will be exercised by the Quarantine Medical Officer, and of the lassport and Customs Regulations, 'which will be exercised by the Passport and Customs Officials respectively of the Shaikh. Aircraft authorized by the Shaikh under the Air Navigation Regulations to y in his territory shall be permitted to use the aerodrome or aerodromes subject to the conditions of this agreement. 4. His Majesty's Government shall not grant without the consent of the Shaikh the use of Uie aerodrome or aerodromes to foreign aircraft. 5. _ Al-i. transactions and correspondence whether by British or Pbreign Companies or Pilots shall be conducted through the British Political Authorities. 6. The Shaikh agrees that His Majesty's Government directly or through their agents shall charge landing and housing fees and other charges at the rates specified in schedules I and II to this agreement as amended from time to time, an that m recognition of His Majesty's Government's expenditure on the aerodromes and of the consideration paid to the Shaikh under clause 16 below, s jes y s Government shall for the period of this agreement retain such fees and charges . 10. His Majesty's Governmont shall have the solo right to supply either directly or through their agents fuel and lubricants to users of the aerodrome at rates which shall be posted up in a prominent place on the aerodrome.2. 12. The Shaikh agrees to grant to His Majesty's Government or their appointed agents the right to send from and receive at any W/T station established and operated under this agreement wireless coniiuunications relating to aircraft and to levy and retain charges in respect of such communication. 13* The Sheikh agrees that His I&ajesty's Government or their appointed agents may levy and retain charges in respect of meteorological reports and messages specially obtained or sent by them in relation to aircraft. 14. mods.abstract: This printed memorandum contains the heads of agreement of the Kuwait Civil Air Agreement between the United Kingdom and Kuwait, signed by the ruler of Kuwait [Shaikh Aḥmad bin Jābir Āl Ṣabāḥ], and Captain Gerald S de Gaury, Political Agent at Kuwait dated 23 May 1938. The agreement contains seventeen numbered paragraphs with details concerning the establishment of an aerodrome or aerodromes and ancillary services, as well as landing and housing fees, supply of fuel and lubricants, appointment of agents, ,and an exemption of duty charges on petrol and oil.
